remarks.para: May be inoperative or individual test functions may be inoperative provided each squib circuit associated with an inoperative test function is verified to be operative once each flight day.

placard.para: Placard SQUIB TEST Switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: For APU and engine, fabricate a squib test lamp with pigtail leads terminating in sockets. Use lamp P/N 387 (28 volt, 40 milliamp) in suitable holder (ref. IPC 33-14-70-05).

warning.para: RESTRICT PERSONNEL FROM FIRE BOTTLE AREA WHILE TESTING. LIMIT SQUIB CURRENT TO 50 MILLIAMPERES MAXIMUM.

numlitem.para: Verify that squib circuit is operative.
Remove M10401 squib test control panel (P61 right side panel).
Connect test lamp between plug D3736 pin 7 (+28 volt source) and pin 12 (pin 14 for bottle #2 – if installed) (ground path through squib).
Remove test lamp and install M10401 squib test control panel.
Remove M10401 squib test control panel (P61 right side panel).
For bottle 1, L Squib; connect test lamp between pins 8 and 3 of connector D3734.
For bottle 1, R Squib; connect test lamp between pins 8 and 3 of connector D3736.
For bottle 2, L Squib; connect test lamp between pins 9 and 4 of connector D3734.
For bottle 2, R Squib; connect test lamp between pins 9 and 4 of connector D3736.

note.para: Pins 3 and 4 connect to +28 volt DC source.
Pins 8 and 9 connect to ground path through squib.

numlitem.para: Remove test lamp and install M10401 squib test control panel.

graphic.title: ENGINE FIRE EXTINGUISHER BOTTLE/DISCHARGE CARTRIDGE INSTALLATION

sheet.title: APU FIRE EXTINGUISHER BOTTLE/DISCHARGE CARTRIDGE INSTALLATION
